tool.name: PAPY

param.name: testdata_input
param.label: Test Dataset. Demo data set (TutorialData.csv) can be downloaded from the link below.

param.name: exp_cols
param.label: Number of columes in the test dataset for power analysis, can be either a single number, e.g., 8 or a range 2-16

data.name: power_rate_byCorrection
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 with Benjamini-Yekutieli correction

data.name: power_rate_byCorrection_slice
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 VS sample size (Benjamini-Yekutieli correction)

data.name: power_rate_byCorrection_slice_eff
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 VS effect size (Benjamini-Yekutieli correction)

data.name: power_rate_noCorrection
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 with no correction

data.name: power_rate_noCorrection_slice
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 VS sample size (no correction)

data.name: power_rate_noCorrection_slice_eff
data.label: Proportion of Power >0.8 VS effect size (no correction)

tool.help:
Demo data set and script for plotting single variables are in the .zip file from the link: https://github.com/jianlianggao/papy/blob/master/papy/papy_demoData_n_plot.zip?raw=true
TutorialData.csv is the demo data set. plotSurface.py is for plotting each single variable, which is included in the PAPY output file (zip file downloadable after PAPY runs).
